page.title: 18Home Life in Alford
page.content: A feature of life in the 80s is that it is now quite usual for both husband and wife to work. Shopping habits have changed. In the past rural areas were served by every imaginable type of travelling" shoppie". Now very few exist. The deep freeze is common place and many bulk-buy groceries locally or in supermarkets in Aberdeen or Dyce. A wide range of fruit and vegetables are bought to augment garden produce. People prefer leaner meat bought from the local butcher. Locally made cheese and butter can still be bought. Oatmeal, once the staple diet, is still widely used in porridge, oat- cakes, haggis and mealy puddings. These served with minced beef and tatties are a popular meal.
